title: 105_s304
content: The "Assisted Suicide Funding Restriction Act of 1997" prohibits the use of federal funds for any program or service that assists in causing suicide, euthanasia, or mercy killing. SEC. 3. RULE OF CONSTRUCTION. This Act does not limit withholding medical treatment, nutrition, abortion, or pain relief. SEC. 4. PROHIBITION OF FEDERAL FINANCIAL PARTICIPATION FOR ASSISTED SUICIDE. The Act prohibits federal financial participation for assisted suicide, euthanasia, or mercy killing, and clarifies that advance directives cannot require causing or assisting in causing death. The Act prohibits federal financial participation for causing or assisting in causing death, such as assisted suicide, euthanasia, or mercy killing. Providers are not required to inform or counsel individuals on obtaining services for these purposes. SEC. 5. RESTRICTING TREATMENT UNDER MEDICARE OF ASSISTED SUICIDE OR RELATED SERVICES. Prohibition of Expenditures under the Social Security Act is amended to include expenses for items or services that cause or assist in causing an individual's death, such as assisted suicide, euthanasia, or mercy killing. Additionally, the treatment of advance directives is clarified to exclude any requirements related to directives that involve purposefully causing or assisting in causing death. The Social Security Act prohibits expenditures for items or services that cause or assist in causing an individual's death, such as assisted suicide, euthanasia, or mercy killing. Providers are not required to inform or counsel individuals regarding their right to obtain such services. SEC. 6 prohibits the use of block grants for social services to provide items or services intended to cause death, such as assisted suicide or euthanasia. SEC. 7 amends the Indian Health Care Improvement Act to prohibit the use of funds for services that cause or assist in causing an individual's death. SEC. 8 addresses the military health care system. The amendment prohibits the provision of any item or service for the purpose of causing or assisting in causing the death of an individual, including assisted suicide, euthanasia, or mercy killing, under certain sections of the United States Code related to health care. The amendment prohibits coverage for health-related services that aim to cause or assist in causing the death of an individual, such as assisted suicide, euthanasia, or mercy killing, under specific sections of the United States Code related to health care. The amendment prohibits coverage for health-related services that aim to cause or assist in causing the death of an individual, such as assisted suicide, euthanasia, or mercy killing, under specific sections of the United States Code related to health care. No contract entered into by the Secretary may include coverage for such services. The amendment prohibits coverage for services that aim to cause or assist in causing death, such as assisted suicide, euthanasia, or mercy killing, under federal employee health benefit plans and for Peace Corps volunteers. SEC. 10 amends the Peace Corps Act to exclude health care services that aim to cause or assist in causing death for volunteers. SEC. 11 addresses medical services for federal prisoners. SEC. 11 amends the provision for medical services for federal prisoners to exclude any services aimed at causing or assisting in causing death. SEC. 12 prohibits the use of federal funds for assisted suicide or related services in the District of Columbia. Sec. 504 prohibits the use of funds in the District of Columbia for assisted suicide or related services, effective from fiscal year 1998.
